column1: TABLE 2. SELECTED VACCINES UNDER DEVELOPMENT FOR COVID-19

column2: Modality
Single-dose intranasal replication-defective adenovirus vector vaccine incorporating the SARS-CoV-2 S protein
column3: Design and synthesis completed; moving toward animal testing and manufacture. Phase 1 trial planned for mid-August.

column2: Self-transcribing and replicating RNA (STARR) vaccine expressing undisclosed epitope(s) delivered by lipid nanoparticle comprising 50% ionizable amino lipid or MC3, 7% 1,2-distearoyl-sn-glycero-3-phosphocholine, 40% cholesterol and 3% 1,2-dimyristoyl-sn-glycerol, methoxypolyethylene glycol
column4: Duke-NUS Medical School (Singapore) will provide rapid screening technology; $10 million in funding from Singapore government

column2: mRNA vaccine (BNT162) expressing codon-optimized undisclosed SARS-CoV-2 protein(s) encapsulated in 80-nm ionizable cationic lipid/phosphatidylcholine/ cholesterol/polyethylene glycol–lipid nanoparticles
column3: Clinical testing to begin late April
column4: Pfizer extends 2018 influenza agreement to work on COVID-19 candidate; Fosun Pharma, which paid $50 million in equity with a further $85 million in milestones, will collaborate in running clinical trials in China

column2: Recombinant SARS-CoV-2 S protein trimer subunit vaccine
column3: In preclinical testing with GlaxoSmithKline’s pandemic adjuvant technology
column4: Partnered with GlaxoSmithKline, which provides pandemic adjuvants platform comprising squalene, dl-α-tocopherol and polysorbate 80

column2: Computationally designed and recoded live attenuated SARS-CoV-2 vaccine
column3: Multiple codon-deoptimized SARS-CoV-2 vaccine candidate genomes designed on the basis of multiple genome sequences
column4: Serum Institute of India to scale-up manufacture

column2: Protamine-complexed mRNA-based vaccine expressing undisclosed SARS-CoV-2 protein(s)

Undisclosed SARS-CoV-2-derived synthetic peptide conjugated at N terminus to the C terminus of the key moiety of the major histocompatibility complex class II–associated invariant chain (Ii protein) containing a four-amino-acid (LRMK) modification (Ii-Key)
column4: EpiVax provides epitope prediction; Institute of Shandong Academy of Sciences tests the reactivity of candidate peptides in blood samples collected from convalescent patients

column2: Modified vaccinia Ankara virus-like particle vaccine based on Wuhan strain of SARS-CoV-2
column4: BravoVax (Wuhan, China) to provide manufacturing and clinical testing

column2: Heat-shock protein gp96 complexed with undisclosed SARS-CoV-2 peptide(s)
Platform based on Agrobacterium-transformed tobacco for producing virus-like particle with undisclosed SARS-CoV-2 peptide(s) combined with its lichenase carrier immunostimulatory adjuvant
column4: Partnering with Beijing CC- Pharming, which has previous MERS vaccine experience

column2: Electroporated DNA vaccine INO-4800 encoding SARS-CoV-2 S protein
column3: Trials to begin in April in United States followed by China and South Korea; 3,000 doses available
column4: Beijing Advaccine Biotechnology partnering for trials in China and Gates Foundation for Celletra electroporation device; funding from CEPI ($9 million) and Gates Foundation ($5 million)

column2: Single-dose intranasal recombinant adenovirus vaccine incorporating undisclosed SARS-CoV-2 protein using human retinal cell line (Per.Co6) scale-up technology
column3: Seven constructs being tested in mice; phase 1 testing anticipated in October 2020 to February 2021

column2: Electroporated linear DNA vaccine
column3: Four candidates of linear DNA vaccine based on S protein and selected epitopes ready for testing by the beginning of May or June
column4: Takis Biotech (Rome) to clinical test candidates in Italy

column2: Undisclosed recombinant SARS-CoV-2 protein virus-like particles produced in tobacco
column3: Virus-like particles produced within 20 days; preclinical testing ongoing with clinical trials to begin summer 2020
column4: Laval University Infectious Disease Research Centre

column2: mRNA vaccine encoding SARS-CoV-2 S protein encapsulated in ionizable lipid, distearoyl phosphatidylcholine, cholesterol and polyethylene glycol lipid
Nanoparticle vaccine displaying SARS-CoV 2 S protein with saponin-based (Matrix-M) adjuvant
Recombinant vaccine of undisclosed SARS-CoV-2 protein(s) expressed in baculovirus system
column3: Advancing preclinical candidate; clinical trial to begin between March and August 2021

column2: Live-attenuated modified horsepox vaccine expressing undisclosed SARS-CoV-2 protein(s) (TNX-1800)
Recombinant subunit vaccine of SARS-CoV-2 S protein locked in prefusion conformation by polypeptide moiety (molecular clamp)
column4: CEPI; Dynavax Technologies to provide Toll-like receptor 9 agonist adjuvant CpG 1018; GlaxoSmithKline to provide pandemic adjuvants platform (squalene, dl-α-tocopherol and polysorbate 80); CSL (Parkville, Australia) to provide MF59 adjuvant (containing squalene in citric acid buffer with stabilizing nonionic surfactants Tween 80 and Span 85)

column2: Oral recombinant adenovirus 5 vector vaccine of undisclosed SARS-CoV-2 protein(s) aimed at mucosal immune response
Human signal peptide domain complexed with undisclosed SARS-CoV-2 protein(s) as vaccine
column3: Vaccine candidate identified by in silico analysis as of mid-March

column2: Electroporated DNA vaccine and live attenuated recombinant measles vaccine vector of undisclosed SARS-CoV-2 protein(s)

column1: Sources: BioWorld, company sites, Thomsen Cortellis, PubMed
